channel.title: CVE Feed for nodejs -- undici
channel.description: The latest CVEs for nodejs -- undici

item.title: CVE-2024-38372|2024-08-28T15:02:48.392Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Depending on network and process conditions of a `fetch()` request, `response.arrayBuffer()` might include portion of memory from the Node.js process. This has been patched in v6.19.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-38372|2024-08-02T04:04:25.265Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Depending on network and process conditions of a `fetch()` request, `response.arrayBuffer()` might include portion of memory from the Node.js process. This has been patched in v6.19.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-38372|2024-07-12T17:01:03.665Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Depending on network and process conditions of a `fetch()` request, `response.arrayBuffer()` might include portion of memory from the Node.js process. This has been patched in v6.19.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-30261|2024-04-04T15:09:11.369Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. An attacker can alter the `integrity` option passed to `fetch()`, allowing `fetch()` to accept requests as valid even if they have been tampered. This vulnerability was patched in version(s) 5.28.4 and 6.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-30260|2024-06-04T17:38:49.201Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Undici cleared Authorization and Proxy-Authorization headers for `fetch()`, but did not clear them for `undici.request()`. This vulnerability was patched in version(s) 5.28.4 and 6.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-38372|2024-07-08T20:25:59.111Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Depending on network and process conditions of a `fetch()` request, `response.arrayBuffer()` might include portion of memory from the Node.js process. This has been patched in v6.19.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-30261|2024-08-02T01:32:06.665Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. An attacker can alter the `integrity` option passed to `fetch()`, allowing `fetch()` to accept requests as valid even if they have been tampered. This vulnerability was patched in version(s) 5.28.4 and 6.11.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-30260|2024-08-02T01:32:05.438Z -- nodejs -- undici
item.description: Undici is an HTTP/1.1 client, written from scratch for Node.js. Undici cleared Authorization and Proxy-Authorization headers for `fetch()`, but did not clear them for `undici.request()`. This vulnerability was patched in version(s) 5.28.4 and 6.11.1.
